com.vernalis.pdbconnector2

Class HtmlEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.HtmlEncoder

  • public final class HtmlEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a simple mechanism to HTML-escape and unescape named entity characters upto HTML 4
    Since:
    1.28.0
    Author:
    S.Roughley knime@vernalis.com

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String str)
        Parameters:
        str - The String to encode with HTML entities
        Returns:
        The HTML-named-entity encoded string. Calls encode(String, boolean, boolean, boolean) with the boolean parameter true, false, false

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String str,
                                      boolean useNamedEntities,
                                      boolean useEntitiesForAllNonalphanumeric,
                                      boolean useHexEntityNumbers)
        Parameters:
        str - The string to encode with HTML named entities
        useNamedEntities - Should a named entity be used in place of the numeric entity code where this exists (upto HTML 4.0)
        useEntitiesForAllNonalphanumeric - Should all non-alphanumeric characters be encoded?
        useHexEntityNumbers - Should hex encoding be used in place of decimal? e.g.
        Returns:
        The HTML named entity-encoded string

      • decode

        public static java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String str)
        Method to remove entity-encoding from an HTML string
        Parameters:
        str - The string to decode
        Returns:
        The decoded String. NB named entities in HTML1.0 not requiring the final ';' will node be decoded
